articles.author: Sarah Metz
articles.title: Climate change is threatening cacao crops, researchers say - CBS News
articles.description: Rising temperatures and shifting rainfall patterns in West Africa, which supplies around 70% of the world's cacao, are disrupting the crop, affecting both the quantity and quality of beans — and driving up prices for consumers.
articles.content: As Valentine's Day approaches, the craving for chocolate intensifies. But chocolate continues to face a significant challenge: Climate change is threatening cacao production, particularly in West Afr… [+4307 chars]
